entry.et: Middle English recognicion, from Anglo-French recognition, from Latin recognition-, recognitio, from recognoscere

def.dt: :the action of recognizing :the state of being recognized: as
:formal acknowledgment of the political existence of a government or nation
:knowledge or feeling that someone or something present has been encountered before
:the sensing and encoding of printed or written data by a machine optical character recognition magnetic ink character recognition
:the process by which the immune system of an organism distinguishes between the body's own chemicals, cells, and tissues and those of foreign organisms and agents
